title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 12 February 2015 - XWiki
content:
<sburjan> has quit  
06:00 <Denis2> has quit  
06:00 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:46 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
07:37 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:44 <sburjan> has quit  
07:44 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
07:50 <mflorea> has quit  
07:54 <gsmeria> has quit  
08:41 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <vmassol> good morning, starting my BFD with XWIKI-11783  
09:33 <vmassol> I think it could be a good idea that each one of us states what BFD issue he's working on  
09:33 <vmassol> I think that can increase the team spirit for this day  
09:34 <vmassol> showing that others are working on BFD items may tempt you to do the same ;)  
09:34 <vmassol> wdyt?  
09:39 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <gsmeria> has quit  
10:12 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <cjd> hrm I need to update the ebox to use the sweden exit  
10:16 <vmassol> cjd: good morning, wrong channel? :)  
10:16 <vmassol> (or you need to explain what ebox and sweden exit are :))  
10:16 <cjd> 10:12 -!- fmancinelli [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] has joined #xwiki <-- musing out loud about this  
10:16 <cjd> 09:12 -!- cjd [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] has joined #xwiki <-- this is the sweden exit  
10:17 <cjd> cjdns.fr is the canada one  
10:17 <vmassol> ok I see  
10:17 <cjd> migrating everything to sweden because crossing the atlantic causes latency  
10:20 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <gsmeria> has quit  
10:26 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <gsmeria> has quit  
12:22 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:40 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:24 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:24 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:09 <alex000> has joined #xwiki  
14:09 <alex000> Hi :)  
14:10 <alex000> I've just updated XWiki, and I've troubles with the navigation panel... Can somebody help me please ?  
14:14 <ClemensR> alex000: which navigation panel? is it Panels.Navigation ?  Maybe you need to clear the browser cache because of new javascript stuff  
14:23 <gsmeria> has quit  
14:28 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <alex000> oh you're right ! With a CTRL+F5, it seems to work :)  
14:57 <alex000> I've an other question, about the "root" parameter  
14:57 <alex000> The first node is "Accueil"  
14:58 <alex000> I've to click left to the text in odrer to see all the spaces  
15:01 <ClemensR> I am a bit lost ... are we still talk about the navigation panel?  (Oh, and which XWiki version is it, actually?)  
15:01 <alex000> is it possible to see all the spaces without clicking the "home" node ?  
15:02 <alex000> Sorry, I still talk about the navigation panel  
15:02 <alex000> It's XWiki 6.4.1  
15:03 <ClemensR> in principle yes ( I think). but you might a) need a different panel ... see the Panel wizard Wiki Admin ... or need to roll your own navigation panel. (Not that hard if you know how to use the macro it uses  
15:04 <alex000> OK, I'll try to do my own navigation panel with the Document Tree Macro  
15:04 <ClemensR> yes, that one :)  
15:04 <alex000> thanks  
15:39 <alex000> Now I've this error : "This is a standalone macro only and it cannot be used inline" ... :(  
15:40 <alex000> (still tlaking about the navigation panel)  
15:45 <ClemensR> alex00: adding an empty line or two above and below the macro should help  
15:48 <alex000> I've already added 2 lines before and after the macro  :D  
15:50 <ClemensR> narf, is the editor eating the empty lines on save?  
15:55 <alex000> when I edit the panel, empty lines are still here  
15:55 <alex000> here's the content :  
15:55 <alex000>  {{velocity}}   #panelheader($services.localization.render('xe.panels.navigation'))   {{documentTree showSpaces="true" showTranslations="false" showAttachments="false" showChildDocuments="false" compact="true" /}}   #panelfooter()   {{/velocity}}  
15:56 <alex000> (all the spaces are 2 empty lines in the editor)  
15:56 <alex000> and here's the result  
15:56 <alex000>  This is a standalone macro only and it cannot be used inline    links="$links" checkboxes="$checkboxes" openTo="#escapeMacroParam($xcontext.macro.params.openTo)"   finder="$finder" /}}  
15:58 <gsmeria> has quit  
16:00 <alex000> here's the screenshot of the editor : http://img4.hostingpics.net/pics/352049xwikieditor.png  
16:01 <ClemensR> actually I see it works in the original panel, so I wonder whats up with it  
16:01 <alex000> and the result : http://img4.hostingpics.net/pics/942159xwikiresult.png  
16:01 <ClemensR> ah, ok, I see there is a newline too much instead, maybe  
16:03 <alex000> could you do a screenshot of the editor, where the velocity code works please ?  
16:04 <ClemensR> ah, ok it is something \*inside\* the macro that cause the problem. too bad. I cannot reproduce it, but the reason is that I might miss some special space name  
16:04 <ClemensR> I think the problem has to do with the  documentTree macro itself, not the content in the panel ... one moment, checking something  
16:05 <alex000> oh, it is because I've special space names on my side ?  
16:05 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
16:05 <alex000> ok I wait  :)  
16:06 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
16:06 <ClemensR> yes, likely "special space names", which of course should not be a problem ... some escaping missing in the macro I think  
16:07 <alex000> ok, do you think it can be fixed in the next update ?  
16:07 <alex000> because the navigation panel is very important for us...  
16:09 <alex000> I confess that I was about to give up XWiki, 'cause we've just stabilized our installation...  
16:10 <alex000> we encountered a lot of problems in the installation and configuration  
16:11 <ClemensR> hm, I cannot reproduce it, looks like all is properly escaped in the macro. on the other hand if you get something like   links="$links"    then something really went wrong  
16:12 <ClemensR> if you are logged in as Admin can you go to the /xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/DocumentTree and check if the page looks ok, and has programming rights (just in case)  
16:14 <ClemensR> if yes, then in the object editor: does this have a " WikiMacroParameterClass 12: links " or the like ?  
16:16 <gsmeria> has quit  
16:17 <Bugen\_do> has joined #xwiki  
16:18 <ClemensR> alex000:  ah, and I remember you said you upgraded the wiki ... from which version was the upgrade? Maybe something got lost in the upgrade process ... should not have happened, but anyway  
16:20 <ClemensR> you might try to import the XWiki.DocumentTree and Macros.Tree pages from the default \*.xar   (and only these), to make sure they are up to date ...  
16:25 <alex000> I've the same troubles in the xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/DocumentTree page  
16:25 <alex000> "  links="$links" checkboxes="$checkboxes" openTo="#escapeMacroParam($xcontext.macro.params.openTo)"   finder="$finder" /}}" under all the titles  
16:26 <alex000> how can I see from which version I've upgraded ?  
16:26 <alex000> I don't remember... sorry  
16:27 <alex000> Oh, I was in 6.4  
16:27 <ClemensR> ah, ok then ... this information is gone. If you have a backup of the old webapp , you could have found the old version a version number of the jars there  
16:28 <ClemensR> ah, upgraded from 6.41. to 6.4 ?  
16:28 <alex000> I took somme screeshot before updating extensions  
16:28 <alex000> from 6.4 to 6.4.1  
16:29 <ClemensR> in any case it seems the tree macro got broken on update, i.e.you can try as you want with your pael it will not work :-/  
16:29 <ClemensR> you should be able to fix the issue by installing a fresh copy of that page, unless you had local modifications  
16:29 <alex000> ok, is it possible to downgrade my instance, or should I restore a backup of my virtual machine (ubuntu)  
16:29 <msmeria> has quit  
16:30 <alex000> ah ok  
16:30 <alex000> how can I install only a fresh version of the page ?  
16:30 <ClemensR> you can get the \*.xar from the download page as   xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki-all-6.4.1.xar, upload it in the import section, and then \*only\* import the XWiki.DocumentTree page from it  
16:31 <ClemensR> if you import the rest of the pages ... then it is maybe a good idea to try to restore backup ;)  
16:32 <ClemensR> now I gonna try reproducing it by upgrading from 6.4 to 6.4.1 (so far have tried with an upgrade from 6.2.3 instead ...)  that will take some time  
16:34 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
16:36 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
16:37 <alex000> "  Error number 11015 in 11: Exception while importing com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 11015 in 11: Exception while importing at com.xpn.xwiki.web.ImportAction.render(ImportAction.java:106) at com.xpn.xwiki.web.XWikiAction.execute(XWikiAction.java:345) at com.xpn.xwiki.web.XWikiAction.execute(XWikiAction.java:146) at org.apa"  
16:37 <alex000> :(  
16:41 <ClemensR> hm, this excaption should have a root cause below  
16:46 <ClemensR> this should contain the actual cause of the problem  
16:49 <ClemensR> (colleage here asks for informations ... brb)  
16:49 <woshilapin> has quit  
16:56 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
16:59 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
16:59 <evalica> has quit  
16:59 <ClemensR> back ... and upgrade 6.4 -> 6.4.1 just finished, too ... without problems, however  
16:59 <Slashman> hello, I'm updating a couple of wikis from 6.4 to 6.4.1 and I have the following errors: "Collision found on property [password] between from value [hash:SHA-512:..." and the some for the property "validkey", should I be concerned?  
17:00 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
17:00 <Chuguniy> has quit  
17:01 <momomomomo> has quit  
17:02 <ClemensR> Slashman: just had the same here, but no real problems. The passwords have not been reset or changed by the upgrade.  
17:02 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:03 <Slashman> ClemensR: okay, I didn't see any issue with the account I used to update the wikis, but I cannot test with every accounts :p  
17:04 <ClemensR> yes I wonder myself where that warning is coming from, but anyway, unless you choose to "install newest version", this will not have changed the password  
17:05 <ClemensR> should only happed for the main "Admin" anyway ... no other users will be touched  
17:09 <Slashman> and since the user admin can still log in, I guess it's okay :p  
17:21 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
17:22 <alex000> ;)  
17:28 <fmancinelli> has quit  
17:43 <alex000> has quit  
17:47 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
18:00 <Pbas> Hello, I writing an application and I need to apply some rights permissions on some doc (provided by couple of MyDocSheet+MyNiceClass) with velocity.  
18:00 <Pbas> Have you got a nice API/documentation or I must use a loop to modify all XWiki.XWikiRights objects attached in MyDoc (I want use velocity script)? Thxs  
18:01 <cjd> has quit  
18:01 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:02 <vmassol> Pbas: check e.x.o  
18:02 <vmassol> there are examples  
18:02 <vmassol> (some snippets)  
18:02 <Pbas> exo? xwiki.org?  
18:03 <vmassol> extensions.xwiki.org  
18:03 <Pbas> ha extension  
18:07 <Pbas> Gotcha http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Setting+Rights developped by ... hum  you! :-)  
18:07 <Pbas> Thanks you  
18:07 <vmassol> :)  
18:08 <vmassol> I'm trying to fix the JNDI issue Pbas  
18:08 <vmassol> I was just able to reproduce it  
18:08 <Pbas> Yes I saw.  
18:08 <Pbas> I saw that 6.4.1 and 7  have same problem  
18:09 <Pbas> BTW https://iwiki.din.developpement-durable.gouv.fr :-)  
18:10 <Pbas> Unfortunaly a closed xwiki  
18:10 <vmassol> yep  
18:10 <D-Spair> has quit  
18:11 <vmassol> regarding jndi the only explanation I have is that some third party lib messes up with the jndi context  
18:11 <vmassol> but that's going to be fun to find out  
18:11 <Pbas> sure ! hum no really in fact!  
18:13 <Pbas> FYI "developement durable" start to study Xwiki to create farms.  
18:16 <Pbas> ho I missunderstood "fun" :-(  
18:16 <Pbas> yes it will be fun.
